name: mcphost
description: CLI host for LLMs to interact with tools via MCP

repo.name: mcphost
repo.description: A CLI host application that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with external tools through the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

readme.summary: Comprehensive and well-structured documentation with excellent clarity, but the README appears truncated mid-configuration section and lacks dedicated troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Configuration section is incomplete (cuts off mid-example for 'Local Servers'), and troubleshooting is limited to only TLS self-signed certificate warnings

injection_risks.description: The fmt.Sprintf function is used with user-controlled input (toolName and toolArgs), which could potentially lead to a format string vulnerability.

critical_findings: Potential format string vulnerability in internal/ui/tool_approval_input.go
Lack of input validation and sanitization in internal/ui/cli.go:GetPrompt()
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but no critical secrets or error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: Tool calling issues with non-Qwen models (ollama)
MCP server integration failures and schema parsing errors
Process hanging on Windows in non-interactive mode
Poor error handling for missing files/invalid configs
sentiment.summary: Community health is poor with 12 open issues spanning critical functionality gaps (tool calling, Windows compatibility, error handling), zero maintainer engagement evident, and no positive sentiment or praise in any issues.

communication.summary: The responses are generally helpful and clear, showing a good level of patience with users. However, there is room for more technical depth in some cases.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-10)
15 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process may be stalled
positive_signals: Recent commit timestamp indicates repository still exists
maintenance.summary: mcphost appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for 6+ months despite having 15 unresolved open issues.

project_metrics.description: A CLI host application that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to interact with external tools through the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and clear, but lacks sufficient troubleshooting information and could benefit from more examples.
concerns: Community: error handling for file paths
Security: Potential format string vulnerability in internal/ui/tool_approval_input.go
Security: Lack of input validation and sanitization in internal/ui/cli.go:GetPrompt()
High bus factor risk (84% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits and releases in the past month
Multiple contributors active over the last six months
A significant number of merged pull requests in the past six months
